  • Element
de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations

Annotation Type XMethod


  • @Retention(value=CLASS)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface XMethod
    Methods inside of a class annotated with XClass can be annotated with XMethod to define that they are intended to be called from the target class. The attributes define the specific call locations.

    The most important attribute is location() which specifies where the injected method should be called.

    Usually, methods have no return type (void). Non-void return types are allowed for XLocation.EXIT (to replace the return value of the intrumented value) and on XLocation.AFTER_INVOCATION to overwrite the return value of the invoked method and the return type is mandatory on XLocation.REPLACE_INVOCATION.

    Author:
    Christian Schenk

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String[] arguments 
      java.lang.String fieldclass 
      java.lang.String fieldname 
      java.lang.String invokedclass 
      java.lang.String invokedname 
      XLocation location 
      java.lang.String[] names 

    • Element Detail

      • names

        public abstract java.lang.String[] names
        Returns:
        a list with one or more method names. If this attribute is set only methods that exactly match one of these names are considered as potential target for injection. If this attribute is not set, all methods inside the target class are potential target for injection.
        Default:
        ""

      • arguments

        public abstract java.lang.String[] arguments
        Returns:
        a list with fully qualified argument types. If this attribute is set only methods that match the provided argument list exactly will be targets for injection. If this attribute is not set, the argument list is not considered when deciding whether to inject code. An empty argument list requirement is specified as arguments={}
        Default:
        ""

      • location

        public abstract XLocation location
        Returns:
        location specifies, where to inject the code. See XLocation for the options. If not set, the injection will take place at method entry see XLocation.ENTRY
        Default:
        de.schenk.jrtrace.annotations.XLocation.ENTRY

      • invokedname

        public abstract java.lang.String invokedname
        Returns:
        valid only for XLocation.BEFORE_INVOCATION and similar: the name of the method that is invoked. If not set, any method will match. If set, any method with the given name will match. If set and the XClass.regex() is true, will match any method name that matches the regular expression provided.
        Default:
        ""

      • invokedclass

        public abstract java.lang.String invokedclass
        Returns:
        valid only for XLocation.BEFORE_INVOCATION and similar: the name of the class on which a method is invoked. If not set, any class will match.
        Default:
        ""

      • fieldclass

        public abstract java.lang.String fieldclass
        Returns:
        only valid for XLocation.GETFIELD and XLocation.PUTFIELD: if set: restricts instrumentation to the class with the specified name. If XClass.regex() is true, restricts instrumentation to the classes that match the specified pattern.
        Default:
        ""

      • fieldname

        public abstract java.lang.String fieldname
        Returns:
        only valid for XLocation.GETFIELD and XLocation.PUTFIELD: if set: restricts instrumentation to the fields with the specified name. If XClass.regex() is true, restricts instrumentation to the fields that match the specified name pattern.
        Default:
        ""
